--------------------
Text: VIRM trains, full name Verlengd InterRegio Materieel ("Lengthened interregional rolling stock"), are a series of electric multiple unit (EMU) double-deck trains operated by Nederlandse Spoorwegen or NS ("Dutch Railways"), the principal railway operator in the Netherlands.
Triplets:<Verlengd InterRegio Materieel
1:
--------------------
<Text: NS VIRM:  NS has 178 of these double-deckers – 98 four-carriage sets, and 80 six-carriage sets.>
Triplets:<NS
2:
--------------------
<Text: NS VIRM: The trains were built between 1994 and 2009 – for the most part by Talbot, part of Bombardier Inc., with some railcars built by De Dietrich.>
Triplets:<NS VIRM
